Authors: Juwitasary H., Christian C., Putra E.P., Baskara H., Firdaus M.W.
Title: The effect of E-service quality on customer satisfaction and loyalty (case study at E-marketplace XYZ in Indonesia)
Source title: Advances in Science, Technology and Engineering Systems
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Juwitasary, H., School of Information Systems, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christian, C., School of Information Systems, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E.P., School of Information Systems, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Baskara, H., School of Information Systems, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Firdaus, M.W., School of Information Systems, BINUS University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Online transactions make it easy for people to get products or sell the products through online applications. The success and failure of online sales depends on how satisfied and loyal the customer is to the service of the product or business which can certainly influence and increase competition between the online sales industry. Based on that background we want to measure how much influence the quality of services provided by the Online Marketplace to customers has an impact on customer satisfaction and customer loyalty. The measurement method used is to use E-Service Quality, to determine customer satisfaction (Customer Satisfaction) and determine the level of customer loyalty (Customer Loyalty). This research uses a quantitative approach and uses random sampling techniques. Data collection using a questionnaire with data samples totaling 102 respondents. The results of this study indicate that there is a significant relationship between E-Service Quality, Customer Satisfaction and Customer Loyalty to customers that increase customer online shopping transactions so that companies are able to compete with other companies. © 2020 ASTES Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Customer Loyalty; Customer Satisfaction; E-Service Quality; Information Systems
References: Yusuf, O., (2014) Pengguna Internet Indonesia Nomor Enam Dunia, pp. 1-2; Soemartono, H.K., Survei APJII: Penetrasi Internet di Indonesia Capai 143 Juta Jiwa (2018) Buletin Asosiasi Penyelenggara Jasa Internet Indonesia, 22 2, p. 3. , Edisi; Maulana, R., Perilaku, T., (2018) Konsumen Belanja Online Indonesia Tahun 2018 Menurut iPrice, , https://id.techinasia.com/tren-perilaku-konsumen-o; (2020) Peta E-Commerce Indonesia, 1. , [Accessed: 10-Jun-2020]; Anh, C.P., (2015) Factors Influence Customer Satisfaction In Mobile Commerce, pp. 6-52. , http://urn.fi/URN:NBN:fi:amk-2015121621158; Danish, R.Q., Himayon, A.A., Iqbal, H.J., Raza, S., Shahid, J., The Impact of Service Quality, Customer Satisfaction and Loyalty Programs on Customer's Loyalty: An Evidence from Telecommunication Sector (2018) European Online Journal of Natural and Social Sciences, 7 (1), pp. 40-47; Chen, Q., Rodgers, S., He, Y., A Critical Review of the E-Satisfaction Literature (2008) American Behavioral Scientist - AMER BEHAV SCI, 52, pp. 38-59; Cronin, J., Taylor, S., Measuring Service Quality - A Reexamination And Extension (1992) The Journal of Marketing, 56, pp. 55-68. , Jr; Oliver, R.L., Whence consumer loyalty? Authors: Sardjono W., Christian L., Juwitasary H., Putra E.P.
Title: Rice development availability model using system dynamics method
Source title: International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 1480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christian, L., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Juwitasary, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 1480, Indonesia; Putra, E.P., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Rice is a strategic food commodity in Indonesia, so the availability and consumption needs of rice need to be considered. in line with population growth and the decline in the area of agricultural land also influences the management of rice availability and has the potential to become a rice supply deficit if it is not managed properly. The purpose of this paper is to develop a pattern of relations between rice availability and rice consumption so that a balance occurs in the management of rice availability. The method used is the System Dynamics model, where this method is able to formulate a complex system by utilizing historically existing data to form a model, therefore this approach is expected to form a performance model of balance between rice availability and consumption which can then be simulated to predict needs in the future so that it can be used for faster and more accurate decision making. © BEIESP.

Authors: Christian L., Juwitasary H., Chandra Y.U., Putra E.P., Fifilia
Title: Evaluation of the E-Service Quality for the Intention of Community to Use NFC Technology for Mobile Payment with TAM
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Christian, L., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Juwitasary, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chandra, Y.U., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E.P., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fifilia, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: NFC technology has been used as a mobile payment tool in Indonesia, so researchers want to evaluate the use of NFC technology for mobile payment. In this study, the researcher used the e-service quality and NFC indicator models from previous studies to determine the importance of using NFC Mobile Payment in Indonesia. The researcher distributed 207 questionnaires using technique-random samples and received 100 valid data with the questionnaire distribution period from October 21 to December 15, 2018. Data and analysis processing in the study used the SEM-PLS method (structural comparison model partially smallest square) using smartPLS statistical software. This study showed that e-service quality influences the perceived usefulness, the perceived usefulness influences intention to use, NFC indicators influence the perceived usefulness and NFC indicators influence the perceived the ease of use. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: e-service quality; mobile payment; NFC indicators; NFC technology; SEM-PLS; TAM
Index Keywords: Data handling; Electronic money; Global system for mobile communications; Information management; Quality control; Quality of service; Surveys; E-service quality; Intention to use; Mobile payment; Nfc technologies; Perceived usefulness; Random sample; Statistical software; Structural comparison; Near field communication

Authors: Luhukay D., Kurniawan Y., Trisnio K., Prasetyo A., Pricensia C., Putra E., Famadi S.
Title: Development of ONCOM (Online Community) platform: A conceptual model
Source title: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisnio, K., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prasetyo, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pricensia, C., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Famadi, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to know and analyse community needs based on current situation and condition, we designing community portal to support information requirement about member registration, member data, community data and event data from a community and to know how a community portal can help storage and the delivery of information about user and event data required can be available quickly and accurately for the members of the community portal. The method used by the author is literature and field study. The author uses the field method to conduct interviews and conduct surveys to find supporting data that helps in the development of information systems portal community. Based on the results of the study, it was found that the designed community portal can help to know the business process of one of the existing community at this time, to help facilitate the community in managing new user candidates as well as old user and event data that has been going on and will take place and facilitate the community in doing storage and delivery of information to users quickly and accurately. © IAEME Publication.

Authors: Putra E.P., Christian L., Juwitasary H., Fifilia
Title: Evaluation Implementation of E-Learning in Teaching and Learning Activities Using SPSS (Case Study Bina Nusantara University)
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putra, E.P., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christian, L., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Juwitasary, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fifilia, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: E-Learning is a media technology that can be used to help learning more effectively and efficiently. The purpose of the study was to evaluate the result of the E-Learning namely Binusmaya 5th version and produce a model that can be used to measure performance improvement. The research methodology used the questionnaire., literature study., observation and analysis of data using confirmatory factor analysis. The questionnaires build based on factors and indicators matrix relationship WELLS Alternative Daniel Y. with the Personalization Factors., System Content Factor., Community Learning Factor., and Learner Interface Factor. The results of this study were to determine the factors and indicators that influence effective and efficient Binusmaya 5th version and create a model used for measuring Binusmaya 5 th version. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Juwitasary H., Christian L., Putra E.P., Fifilia, Sardjono W.
Title: Business Process Management System Implementation Model for Improving Employee Performance
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Juwitasary, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christian, L., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E.P., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fifilia, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sardjono, W., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Business Process Management Systems focuses on the development of the company's business processes in improving the relationship between the customer and the supplier (supply chain management) to fulfill customer demand. This process focuses on understanding the needs of the company's business processes to improve employee performance. The purpose of the study was to define business process management systems implementation model that can be used to measure employee performance improvement. The research methodology used the literature study, observations, questionnaires, and analysis of data using factor analysis. Results obtained from the research is a new factor analysis and indicators that can be used as a basis business process management systems implementation model for employee performance measurement model. Thus it can be concluded that in this study, the example of the company used in the study has an inadequate business process management system so that the results of this study produce a business process management implementation model that can be used as a benchmark in improving employee performance in a better direction. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: business process panagement system; factor analysis; key performance indikator

Authors: Christian L., Juwitasary H., Putra E.P., Fifilia, Chandra Y.U.
Title: Development Model Availability of Rice in Indonesia Using System Dynamics Approach
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Christian, L., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Juwitasary, H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E.P., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fifilia, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Chandra, Y.U., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Rice is one of the food crops that cannot be replaced for the people of Indonesia. Rice is a primary food of Indonesia's population. With the need for availability of rice will also be arranged for not until blackspots. Indonesia has the level of rice consumption of 125.67 kg / capita / year (data Ministry of Agriculture Indonesia, 2015). Rice also has a strategic role in the stability of food security. The purpose of this study was to analyze the availability of rice as consumption in the future, we use a Vensim equation, then the simulation using historical data to produce graphs. The graph shows a steady population growth then create a simulation of the dynamic model for planning the provision of rice and provide policy alternatives for decision makers. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Agriculture; Decision making; Dynamics; Food products; Food supply; Information management; Models; Decision makers; Development model; Historical data; Population growth; rice; Strategic role; system; System dynamics approach; Population statistics

Title: Trend of NFC Technology for payment transaction
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putra, E.P., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fifilia, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Juwitasary, H., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Implementation of NFC Technology was developed to facilitate instant payment transaction such as purchase tickets, goods, or service to become one of the digital wallet besides to using credit cards. The high rate of mobile devices usage in Indonesia make many companies take advantage of this device as a media in electronic payment transactions, a lot of banking and financial product in Indonesia used this technology such as E-money, T-cash, Flazz, Ooredoo, Dompetku, XL-Tunaiku, Doku Wallet, Skye card, Artajasa MYNT and many more. The technique that used in this research to prove the hypotheses was Structural Equation Model (SEM) using Smart PLS software, we will used questionnaire and literature review method to found trend of NFC use. The population from which to draw conclusion was defined as all individual capable use NFC Technology for payment transaction. In this study, we will investigate NFC use in Indonesia, The proposed research model was develop by TAM Framework with some dimension from NFC study literature that is Mobile Payment Knowledge, Technology, Trust, Behaviour and Compatibility into the model, in order to determine the significant factor that influence of NFC use in Indonesia. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Digital wallet; Instant payment; NFC; PLS; SEM; TAM model
